titleStmt.title: Her Maiesties most princelie answere, deliuered by her selfe at the court at VVhite-hall, on the last day of Nouember 1601 When the speaker of the lower house of parliament (assisted with the greatest part of the knights, and burgesses) had presented their humble thanks for her free and gracious sauour, in preuenting and reforming of sundry grieuances, by abuse of many grants, commonly called monopolies. The same being taken verbatim in writing by A.B. as neere as he could possibly set it downe.
titleStmt.author: Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.
A. B., fl. 1601.

notesStmt.note: Sometimes also known as: The Golden Speech.--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Emmanuel College (University of Cambridge). Library.
